bibl.note: In this letter dated October 8, 1863 Major General Ambrose Burnside in Knoxville, Tenn. Writes to E. M. Stanton, Secretary of War in Washington D.C. that O.P. Temple is a " man whose integrity of charactir & purpose" and a true friend of the Union.

div.p: I have the honor to introduce to you Col O.P. Temple a resident of East Tennessee and a man thoroughly identified with the people of this portion of the state - He is a gentle man in whom I have the utmost confidens as to integrity of charactir & purpose, and his statements you may fuly rely upon. He is a strong friend of the Union, and will be able to give you much valuable information as to the condition of this people their loyalty, the raising of troops etc.
I command him to your very kind attention
